awd_titl_txt: Phase Factors and Gauge Potentials in Molecular Theory
awd_abstract_narration: In this project in the Theoretical and Computational program of                 the Chemistry Division, Professor Mead proposes to develop a                    new general theory to describe the detailed way in which                        molecules interact with each other and with applied magnetic                    fields.                                                                                                                                                           A general theory will be developed which will enable one to                   correlate rovibronic states with nuclear spin states for                        clusters of any size.  In addition, the role of Kramers                         degeneracy will be investigated.  The definition and                            determination of quasidiabatic basis sets, which facilitate                     computation of coupling between electronic states, will be                      investigated, as will a new elegant and convenient way of                       describing the magnetic shielding of the nuclei by electrons.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
